title: Locals at favourite travel spots reveals their pet hates about tourists
text:

Living in a tourist destination has many benefits, but it also brings with it huge inconveniences for the people who have to live there.
In capital cities, locals often grumble about the various sins visitors commit, from crowding pavements to pushing up prices, while in rural locations complaints often include littering and feeding the wild animals.
Now, a new internet thread has urged users who live in popular tourist spots to share their bugbears.
People who live at various top travel destinations have been sharing their biggest bugbears about tourists (picture posed by models)
The question on Reddit was enthusiastically received by disgruntled internet users, who responded in droves with their pet hates.
One of the most popular gripes was the way that tourists tend to stop suddenly in busy spots.

Share this article Share A user called DDBB4LYF said: 'I've thought about writing a travel guide titled: "Welcome to New York: that's not a good place to stand."
'Seriously, every time I go to Manhattan, I almost flatten some a** on the sidewalk who decides to just stop in front of me.'
Locals often get annoyed when groups of tourists block the pavement at busy visitor attractions like the London Eye (pictured)
Another user called what_wags_it added: 'Manhattan sidewalk = middle American highway If you need to stop, PULL OVER.'
It seems the issue is just as much of a problem for people living in London though, with one Brit called NorthernMemories, who works in Piccadilly Circus, listing their top five gripes about having to manoeuvre around tourists in the capital.
They said: 'Littering, standing on the wrong side of escalators, stopping immediately by ticket barriers, stopping at the entrances of train platforms, being in a large groups and blocking the entire pavement and finally, expecting people who live and work in tourist hotspots to wait patiently before walking across where you are taking a photo.'
It seems photo opportunity spots are one of the main bugbears of locals because of their ability to attract static groups for long periods of time.
One user called Funny-lookin added to NorthernMemories' comments by saying: 'I feel bad for the buses and other people who have to drive down Abbey road everyday.
'The queues to take photos on the zebra crossing can get pretty nuts.'
Watching people take selfies on ipads is a pet hate of many people (picture posed by models)
Photograph opportunities aren't just annoying because of the way people congregate though, they are also an annoyance because in their desire to get a good picture many tourists ignore rules about photography.
One user called bonniesk said their biggest bugbear was: 'Taking pictures with flash where flash is strictly prohibited.
'I saw this happening at Versailles with these obnoxious, clueless tourists who obviously didn't read the signs.'
While another contributor called sidious911 admitted that they were irked by anyone: 'Taking pictures with your iPad.'
Often tourists will stop abruptly in a busy street if they spot something that attracts their attention
In rural areas, many saved their heaviest criticism for visitors who didn't show enough respect for nature.
One of the worst offences is the litter that is left behind by visitors at places like national parks or on the beach.
